title: CompTIA Network+ N10-009 Practice Quiz (Advanced)
description: Challenge your understanding of the CompTIA Network+ N10-009 exam objectives with this difficult-level quiz.

questions.questionText: Which of the following best describes the function of a network security group (NSG) in a cloud environment?
options: It provides DNS resolution for virtual machines.
It acts as a virtual firewall to control inbound and outbound traffic.
It manages user authentication and authorization.
It facilitates load balancing across multiple servers.
questions.correctAnswer: It acts as a virtual firewall to control inbound and outbound traffic.
questions.explanation: A Network Security Group (NSG) functions as a virtual firewall in cloud environments, controlling inbound and outbound traffic based on defined security rules.

questions.questionText: What is the primary purpose of implementing a switch virtual interface (SVI) on a managed switch?
options: To enable VLAN tagging on trunk ports.
To provide Layer 3 routing capabilities between VLANs.
To assign MAC addresses to VLANs.
To monitor traffic statistics on individual ports.
questions.correctAnswer: To provide Layer 3 routing capabilities between VLANs.
questions.explanation: A Switch Virtual Interface (SVI) allows for Layer 3 routing between VLANs on a managed switch, facilitating inter-VLAN communication.

questions.questionText: Which of the following protocols is commonly used to automate the configuration of network devices using a client-server model?
questions.explanation: Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) automates the assignment of IP addresses and other network configurations to devices on a network.

questions.questionText: In the context of network security, what is the primary function of implementing port security on a switch?
options: To encrypt data transmitted over the network.
To prevent unauthorized devices from connecting to the network.
To assign dynamic IP addresses to devices.
To monitor traffic for malicious activity.
questions.correctAnswer: To prevent unauthorized devices from connecting to the network.
questions.explanation: Port security restricts access to a switch port based on MAC addresses, preventing unauthorized devices from connecting to the network.

questions.questionText: A user reports intermittent connectivity issues. Upon investigation, you notice a high number of CRC errors on the switch port. What is the most probable cause?
questions.explanation: Cyclic Redundancy Check (CRC) errors often indicate physical layer issues, such as a faulty or damaged network cable.

questions.questionText: Which IPv6 address type is used to communicate with all nodes on a local network segment?
questions.explanation: IPv6 multicast addresses are used to send a single packet to multiple destinations on a local network segment.

questions.questionText: What is the primary benefit of using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) in network deployments?
options: Enhanced physical security of network devices
questions.explanation: Infrastructure as Code (IaC) enables automated and consistent deployment and management of network configurations through code.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is a key characteristic of a zero trust security model?
options: All users are trusted by default.
Access is granted based on network location.
Continuous verification of user identity and device health.
questions.correctAnswer: Continuous verification of user identity and device health.
questions.explanation: Zero trust security requires continuous verification of user identities and device health, regardless of their location within the network.

questions.questionText: Which protocol is commonly used to securely manage and configure network devices over an unsecured network?
questions.explanation: Secure Shell (SSH) provides encrypted communication for securely managing and configuring network devices over unsecured networks.

questions.questionText: You are troubleshooting a network issue and suspect a problem with the routing table. Which command would you use on a Windows system to view the routing table?
questions.explanation: The 'route print' command on Windows displays the current routing table, aiding in network troubleshooting.
